issue.description: Warning Map1: surface_curve NOT FOUND in mapping of Constructive_geometry Assertion to: Warning Map1: offset_surface NOT FOUND in mapping of Constructive_geometry Assertion to: Warning Map1: oriented_surface NOT FOUND in mapping of Surface Assertion to:
Missing single quote in constructive_geometry_representation_relationship WR3
Insufficient key words - add tolerance zones, dimensioning
The introduction is the point where someone decides whether or not the module is useful - a fuller introduction to the module is required.
Scope needs revising to reflect more accurately the scope of the module. Out-of-scope statements are needed
Should this be a Generic select?
This should be made Generic Extensible, in order to extend to other construction points (e.g. centre of a CSG sphere)
Is the ":=:" at the end of WR1 correct?

The cardinality of base_geometry and axilliary_geometry should be S[1:?] or L[1:?] to be able to identify constructions built by the combination of entities, and which construct multiple entites. For example, in 2D a rolling ball offset at a concave corner will produce two or three offset elements, depending on whether the corner radius is less than or greater than that of the corner.

comment.description: Harmonized with AP214. Use multiple instances of this entity as appropriate.

issue.description: I would prefer "one-parameter" to "mono parametric", as the latter is not normal usage
Why is curve limited to 3-D? What about 4-D systems?

comment.description: Scope is harmonized with AP214. Geometry is based on geometric models in part 42 which are limited to .LE. 3-D.

issue.description: Replace sentence starting "A Curve is defined..." by, "A Curve is a compact, continuous one-dimension subspace, such as that generated by a continuous one-parameter function over an interval of the Real numbers." Should the term "Curve" be defined in section 3?

comment.description: Added definition proposed except removed "compact" to allow for infinite length, plus it seems too formal. The definition of curve is incorporated by normative reference to part 42. SO I would prefer not too sound too mathematically formal, since the part 42 definition must win.

issue.description: Replace definition with "A Line is a type of Curve which is straight. A Line is considered infinite." A better name for the attribute would be Straight_line.

comment.description: Fixed as proposed. Agree that straight line is better, but Line is harmonized with AP214 usage.

issue.description: The definition does not make sense.

comment.description: Modified the definition. This entity is structured per AP214 and original definition was copied from it.

issue.description: "A Plane is a type of Surface that is flat. Planes are considered as infinite."
Remove second sentence of defintion, as it is incorrect (e.g. some curves are defined by intersections).

comment.description: Semantics are intended to be the same as part 42 point_on_curve. Definition if verbatim from part 42. Other cases can be modeled as derived_geometry

issue.description: Definition is incorrect. "A Point_on_surface is a type of Detailed_geometric_model_element that is a point that lies on the surface defined by the supporting_surface." The second sentance is far too restrictive.

comment.description: Semantics are intended to be the same as part 42 point_on_surface. Definition if verbatim from part 42

issue.description: Point_on_surface.supporting_surface "is the Surface on which the point lies".
"A Surface is a type of Detailed_geometric_model_element that is a compact, continuous 2D subspace of a 3D space." Parametric surfaces are only one type of surface.

comment.description: Fixed but removed compact, since a Plane is a subtype and is infinite.

issue.description: Why is this constrain necessary? A point may be defined as the intersection of a curve and a surface, and is therefore simultaneously a Point_on_curve and Point_on_surface.

comment.description: This constraint is needed because each maps to a particular specialization of geometric_representation_item which has the same a constraint in part 42.

issue.description: The ARM seems to consider only the possibility of B-Rep type 3D systems, and excludes the Constructive Solid Geometry systems and 4D systems (such as some Kinematics approaches exhibit). If this is the intention, then this should be explicitly stated in the scope.

comment.description: Modified the scope to not cover CSG and 4-D

'measuring direction' should be 'measurement path'

comment.description: Current string, while perhaps misleading, has been harmonized with AP214. Only recourse is submit SEDS to AP214

The termination of Measurement_path.defined_by is incorrect. (It would also be better if some of the kinks in the lines were tidied up.)

A Constructive _geometry is defined as a type of Representation that contains a collection of geometric elements used to support the definition of a Geometric_ model. The term "Constructive_ geometry" may be misunderstood as the "constructive _solid geometry" composed of primitive solid. Change the entity name if possible.
